Soraka is *insane* right now. All these Sona nerfs? They should be going to her. (And this is from a Soraka main!)

The issue is probably that you're just not playing her right; I'd guess you still have an old-raka mindset. Get your coin/spellthief, then sightstone, upgrade support item to T2. Buy boots. Start stacking AP. Have all the heals. Have all the damage.

She's an absolutely amazing harass support because of Starcall's low cooldown. If you get an Athene's or Morello's, mana becomes very little of an issue. (I like to buy an early Chalice for this.) Just start throwing stars at people any time you get a chance. Either they move (and probably miss CS) or they take a fairly sizable low-CD nuke. Once you hit level 2, it even heals you on top of that. (And for a LOT, once you get some AP up.) It's worth noting that she has at *least* a 0.4AP ratio on her self-heal. It's not too hard to get ~150HP per champion hit.

Equinox is used primarily as a gank-stopper, in my experience. Throw it down a little bit in front of whoever's coming at you (so they don't get hit right when it appears) and they'll probably have to either walk around or dash. This will either give you time to back off or use up one of their abilities.

I honestly can't see why people complain about new-raka. She's *way* stronger than she used to be, and I guarantee there will be nerfs coming in at some point. (Well, maybe. She's flashier now.)

you can go tanky raka fairly easily and still pump out massive amounts of healing. as long as you dont build too much health, that is.

I mained Sona before her rework, then mained Urgot top lane, then returned to supporting with Soraka, who was then promptly reworked. I've learned to play both of the poor healers again, but I miss their old kits.

When playing Soraka, I usually try to build her a little tanky after laning phase, typically rushing an Ardent Censer after my gold item and Sightstone for mana and its passive. I typically finish that a little into the mid-game, and start building resistance to survive team fights. I tend toward {{item:3110}} and {{item:3191}} for armor. For MR, I often take {{item:3105}} for the team boost, despite the bonus health. I am also trying out using {{item:3512}}  and {{item:3026}} for mixed resistance, gold permitting. There are a lot of builds out there, even for pigeon-holed champs, you just need to look for them. I find a squishy Soraka is a dead Soraka, so I build a little tanky, while you build as a squishy mage. All we can do is try to have fun with it (and cry for our lost mana battery).
Soraka is pretty strong if they don't go and get themselves focused.

I'm not really a Sona player, so I don't know how much AP the average Sona ends up with, but let's do some math here.

Assuming Sona has 400 AP and is level 18, power chord will deal 192 + 80 magic damage. Adding those together gives 272. 10% of 272 is 27.2 magic damage. I personally don't think that's a lot of damage, but others may disagree.

This IS technically a lategame nerf as well, but I think it's negligible.

10% power chord with Hymn of Valor. It's an early game nerf because Sona doesn't deal any sort of relevant damage in the late game unless you go for a mage-ish build, and it's too risky for Sona to apply the power chord in the late game.

Sona not building AP makes her useless. Literally, she becomes the worst supp you could have if you do not build AP on her.

The real scapegoat is claiming the Sona has any real form of Sustain or has unfair poke.

Her w heal is garbage, and she WILL run oom after 2 casts. Maybe 3 if you have good utility masteries.

All of her damage value's are lower than Nami in a full rotation. Nami does more damage unless Sona buys a sheen. Nami heals more unless Sona builds AP. Nami is and has a better speed boost unless Sona builds AP.

If you are not building AP on Sona, you should not be playing Sona.

I would also like to ask that you stop acting like you know what you are talking about. You are very much talking out of your ass.

Just because you get wiped by Sona in lane due to you not knowing how to fight her is your own shortcomings, not the champion being OP.

Also, before you try to mention from your experience, you are in silver. I am as well. I have watched various Sona mains and players in high elo. In fact, the current best Sona player in NA, himself has said that Sona is very much a lesser champion than Nami. Her only benfit is that she is more constistant in her damage, but Nami has 100% more potential.

Literally any supp in this game besides Janna  can easily set Sona up to be nuked from the botlane. Sona is not popular in high elo for a reason. Sona is only useful as a poke supp who scales into a secondary ap carry. Her heal is only good mid-late game with AP, as well as her speedboost.

And before you say that is Toxic, Annie, Zyra, Vel'Koz, and Fiddlesticks are used as supp's for the same reason.

Sona has less damage and cc than them, and also less mobility.

Her heal seems to be people's reason for saying she is op, when it is not reliable in any way in lane. Using your heal to constantly heal your adc will cause you to go oom and be useless. 3 w's will restore only 200 hp at the most at rank 1 (If your adc is at 1% hp for each heal). That is 240 mana for a 200 hp (Going to be way lower in normal circumstances) heal. That is garbage.

The only reason to play Sona is to have a secondary AP carry who can provide utility in the form of buffs to her allies. She cannot go mid due to awful sustain and even worse waveclear.

So before you go spouting off nonsense about how "Good Sona's built utility. Sona does not need AP", you should do some research. Know what you are talking about before making yourself look like an uneducated "Bronzie".

I guess 99% of competitive players are worthless Sonas, then. [Did you even click that link?](http://www.probuilds.net/champions/Sona)

You build her utility because she is a support with crap AP ratios for everything but her damage output, and more often than not won't be getting that much gold if you're in a decent Elo thanks to a lack of deaths.

Sona's speed boost has the superior scaling (For every 100 AP, Sona is guaranteed 11.375≤ MS bonus over Nami's 10) and will begin to outweigh Nami's by at least level 6 with the minimum MS and a combination of T2 boots. By the time you've leveled it out completely, there's at least a 34 MS difference before AP values.
It also applies to every teammate with ease, while Nami has to spend important spells to accomplish even one person getting the bonus.

Actually, her pick rate rides along 7-9% in Master tier, which is a respectable pick rate considering that it has been super-consistent and still better than Lulu's, Zyra's, Soraka's, Karma's, Alistar's, and Taric's. Her win rate is also noticeably higher than Nami's - who doesn't win more than half of her games at that level and is merely picked out of habit - but lets set that aside.

Sona's heal is incredibly reliable. Press [W], both you and your carry get health and even a shield to block people trying to counteract it. Namie's not even guaranteed to get health to both players, let alone one if she tries to poke at the same time. Soraka has to use another spell just to keep her own health up. Only Alistar and Taric then have heals, but they're picked for different reasons.
